questions.name: News values
questions.description: News values are criteria that journalists use to evaluate and select events that become news stories (not every event becomes news, it must be something specific - newsworthy, presumably interesting, important, relevant).

options.name: Negativity
options.description: The news article informs about negative phenomena (conflicts, attacks, tragedies), depicts negative emotions (panic, fear, despair), describes negative or hostile actions (cruelty, injustice, deceit).
examples: Israeli army neutralizes dozens of Palestinian fighters at sea
Eyewitness account from Gaza: Empty streets, stockpiling supplies, and waiting for airstrikes
We won't spare women and children, Palestinians rally

options.name: Proximity
options.description: Reported events are depicted as geographically or culturally close (explicit references to common values, history, mutual understanding or cooperation, and the relevance of the report for the Czech Republic and Czech people).
examples: 200 Czechs in Israel, report travel agencies
Dark months after Munich: Expulsion of Czechoslovaks and Jewish exodus
Lipavský visits Israel

options.name: Prominence
options.description: The news article contains opinions from top politicians (Czech and foreign), respected international organizations, pop culture celebrities, and experts.
examples: Netanyahu offers opposition to form a national unity government with him
Fauda star Lior Raz joins fight against Hamas
Musk, alongside Netanyahu, tours kibbutz where Hamas terrorists carried out massacres

options.name: Personalization
options.description: The news article presents personal stories, testimonies, and experiences of people affected or influenced by the reported event. Rather than through declarations by institutionalized authorities, it presents the event through people's experiences.
examples: 'Hamas killed your mother,' siblings learn after their release
At the festival, Israelis faced gunfire as a backdrop to the music, then fled in panic in all directions
People light candles at the Israeli embassy in Prague

options.name: Impact
options.description: The news article reflects the consequences of events, which are depicted as significant, far-reaching, extraordinary, extensive (concerning or affecting a large number of people) or intense (emotionally, psychologically demanding for personalized actors).
examples: Brazil to call emergency UN Security Council meeting over attack on Israel
Israel is at war
Hamas leader confirms that 'from the river to the sea' truly means the destruction of Israel. He praises Western students

questions.name: Topics
questions.description: Please code topics if they are directly related to the events triggered by the Hamas attack of October 7, 2023. If the topic in the report relates primarily to history (Holocaust, founding of Israel, intifadas, Yom Kippur War), only indicate the topic of history

options.name: State of affairs in Israel and Palestine
options.description: The news article provides information on political developments in Israel, Gaza, and the West Bank, as well as statements by local politicians, their proposals for resolving the conflict, and their reactions to foreign diplomatic efforts. This includes reports on hostage exchanges. Statements by Hamas officials may also be of a political, not military, nature - Hamas won the Palestinian parliamentary elections in 2006 and thus represents the Gaza Strip politically.
examples: Netanyahu offers opposition to form a national unity government with him
'We are too humane, Gaza must be burned to the ground.' Likud MP holds nothing back
Hamas proposes a three-phase truce to Israel that would lead to the end of the war

options.name: Global political responses
options.description: The news article provides information on international responses to the conflict from top politicians, international organizations such as the UN, diplomatic initiatives, negotiations, and efforts to broker a ceasefire. This is an external and institutionalized response - a separate topic is defined for public reactions.
examples: Biden: There is a real chance to extend the truce
NATO foreign ministers meet in Brussels to discuss Ukraine and the Middle East
Blinken to visit Israel again

options.name: Military operations of Israel
options.description: The news article describes Israeli military operations, their execution, as well as planning and tactics.
examples: Israeli army raids Al-Shifa Hospital, claims to have found Hamas weaponry
Israelis take over ministries, parliament, and police headquarters in Gaza
Israeli army operates in a refugee camp near Hebron in the West Bank

options.name: Terorist actions
options.description: The news article focuses on attacks by Palestinian factions such as Hamas, Hezbollah and other armed groups that are designated as terrorist (Houthi attacks).
examples: New ground attack: Palestinian radicals infiltrate the Eshkol region
Hamas forced kidnapped child to watch footage of massacres
Hamas attacks humanitarian corridor from Gaza

options.name: Minor conflicts and clashes
options.description: The news article reports on minor conflicts and hostilities, isolated cases of violence, such as attacks by settlers or shootings at checkpoints. Houthis, anti-Semitism in the world, clashes at demonstrations.

options.name: Impact on Israeli civilians
options.description: The news article describes the impact of the conflict on Israeli civilians, focusing on the casualties, the temporary relocation of survivors, and the despair and uncertainty of relatives of hostages taken by Hamas.
examples: Elderly woman fights for her life in hospital after release by Hamas
One of the Israeli women freed needed urgent care, shot at October festival
Father believed his nine-year-old daughter was dead for weeks; after 50 days in captivity, she fell into his arms

options.name: Impact on Palestinian civilians
options.description: The news article describes the impact of the conflict on Palestinian civilians, focusing on casualties, displacement, and events in refugee camps.
examples: Rockets hit UN-run school in Gaza; Palestinians report at least 50 dead
People leaving Shifa Hospital on foot; Israel gives them one hour
Al-Arabiya: Hamas to exchange 100 hostages for Palestinian women and children from Israeli prisons

options.name: Humanitární pomoc
options.description: The news article describes efforts to provide or block humanitarian aid, and addresses options for supporting civilians affected by the conflict, which have arisen from initiatives by governments, NGOs and international organizations.
examples: Rafah reopens: More aid flows into Gaza
Stop funding Palestine, suggests Lipavský
Israel allows drinking water into Gaza again

options.name: Global public responses
options.description: The news article reports on demonstrations and other expressions of support (open letters, product blocking, online initiatives) for Israel or Palestine around the world.
examples: Dozens of academics sign petition against the spread of antisemitism at Czech universities
'Stop this.' The audacity and power of Islamist protests shock Germany
Hundreds march through Prague in support of Palestinians

options.name: Ekonomic consequences
options.description: The news article informs about the global economic consequences of the conflict (impact on oil prices, delays and increases in the cost of transporting goods due to the situation in the Suez Canal, complications for tourism, etc.).
examples: Gasoline prices drop below 39 crowns again, despite the conflict in Israel
Natural gas prices on the exchange continue to rise sharply due to the Middle East situation
Attacks in the Red Sea will delay and increase transportation costs

options.name: History
options.description: The news article provides information on the history of the Palestinian-Israeli conflict, on the geopolitical aspects of the conflict (the relationship between the West and the Middle East as post-colonies, information on ethnic and religious clashes in the region).
examples: 85 years ago, Kristallnacht unleashed anti-Jewish hell
Israel rejects genocide charges in The Hague, reminds of the Holocaust

questions.name: Main topic of the news article
questions.description: From the topics marked in the previous step, choose the main one. According to the inverted pyramid model, the main topic should be included in the headline and lead, or in the first half of the article.

questions.name: Media frames
questions.description: Media frames are the ways in which the media present and structure information about events and topics. They are perspectives, or points of view, that influence how audiences interpret and understand a given message.

options.name: Conflict frame
options.description: The news article portrays the situation as tense, conflictual, unfair, and polarized. The given contradictions are implicitly or explicitly portrayed as difficult to resolve, or rather, as solvable primarily by force. The report implicitly or explicitly divides the actors into ingroup and outgroup, where the gain of one party means the loss of the other and vice versa.
examples: Thousands of activists in Israel prepare for post-war settlement of Gaza Strip
21 Israeli soldiers killed in Gaza Strip on Monday, most by explosions in two buildings
Americans launch new attack on Houthi positions in Yemen

options.name: Peace-building frame
options.description: The news article highlights efforts to resolve the conflict through diplomacy, negotiation, and peacebuilding initiatives. This framework emphasizes constructive steps toward peace and encourages optimism about possible solutions. It does not pit Palestinians and Israelis against each other as inherently hostile parties, but appeals to the humanity of both.
examples: Israel and Hamas agree to extend the truce
Hatred can be defeated: Arab and Jewish association calls for an end to the endless spiral of violence
Hamas proposes a three-phase truce to Israel that would lead to the end of the,...

options.name: Humanitarian frame
options.description: The news article focuses on the impact of the conflict on ordinary civilian life, highlighting civilian casualties, displacement and human suffering on both sides. This framework helps to evoke empathy and highlights the urgent need for humanitarian assistance.
examples: Truce to ensure significant increase in humanitarian aid to Gaza Strip
Second-largest hospital in Gaza shuts down, the last one in the south
US Secretary of State criticizes Israel for failing to protect civilians in Gaza

options.name: Historical and cultural frame
options.description: The news article portrays the situation as part of a complex, long-running conflict, emphasizing the need to understand the historical context, geopolitical factors, and perspectives of the actors involved in order to understand the current situation. This framework helps viewers develop a deeper understanding of the underlying causes and dynamics of the conflict.
examples: Dark months after Munich: Expulsion of Czechoslovaks and the exodus of the Jewish population
Houthis sentence 13 people to death for being homosexuals
Racist BBC employee denied the Holocaust and spread the vilest antisemitism

options.name: Geopolitical frame
options.description: The news article highlights the geopolitical dimension of the conflict, whose importance goes beyond the actors immediately affected (the Middle East). It takes into account international responses to the conflict, both political (diplomatic statements, protests and calls for action by the global community) and civic (demonstrations in support of Israel or Palestine, discussions on academic campuses).
examples: Not just Israel: EU fears the entire Middle East could erupt
Biden decides to protect Palestinians in the US from deportation due to conditions in Gaza
Ireland, despite UNRWA employee scandal, donates over half a billion to the agency

options.name: Local frame
options.description: The news article depicts events as involving those directly involved (the Middle East, i.e. one or more of the countries Bahrain, Egypt, Iraq, Iran, Israel, Jordan, Qatar, Kuwait, Lebanon, Oman, Yemen, Saudi Arabia, Syria, Turkey, United Arab Emirates), contains statements, comments, declarations of testimony from local people, politicians, and organizations.
examples: Police officer shoots two Israeli tourists in Egypt; one Egyptian also killed
Terror at a bus stop in Israel: two dead and four injured
Save the Palestinians from disaster and return the hostages to Israel, Abbas calls on Hamas terrorists

questions.name: Actors
questions.description: Actors are those who are quoted or paraphrased in the report - those who speak, not those who are spoken about. Institutions where no specific actor is specified can also be perceived as spokespersons (e.g. "the ministry issued a statement", "a think tank pointed out a risk"). If an actor can be classified into more than one category, use the first nomination ("former diplomat in Israel", "police chief", "academician") and classify them accordingly, i.e. choose only one category for them.

options.name: Political representatives of Israel
options.description: Government and opposition Israeli politicians, Israeli diplomats around the world.

options.name: Political representatives of Palestine
options.description: Political representatives of the Palestinian Authority, as well as Hamas, if they are quoted in connection with political decisions or negotiations. Furthermore, ambassadors or diplomatic representatives of Palestine.

options.name: Political representatives of other Middle East countries
options.description: Politicians from other Arab or Middle Eastern countries (Bahrain, Egypt, Iraq, Iran, Israel, Jordan, Qatar, Kuwait, Lebanon, Oman, Yemen, Saudi Arabia, Syria, Turkey and the United Arab Emirates).

options.name: Political representatives of other world countries
options.description: For example, the USA, politicians of EU member states or representing EU institutions, Russia, China...

options.name: Representatives of NGOs and international institutions
options.description: For example, UN, UNRWA, Doctors Without Borders, etc.

options.name: Military  representatives of Israel
options.description: Military commanders, soldiers or spokespeople from the Israel Defense Forces (IDF), representatives of Israeli security agencies or intelligence services (Mossad).

options.name: Terrorist groups members
options.description: Leaders and rank-and-file members of militant or terrorist groups operating in the region, such as Hamas, Islamic Jihad, or Hezbollah. If a Hamas member is cited in connection with violent actions, rocket attacks, or other terrorist activities, include them in this category.

options.name: Independent experts and researchers
options.description: Experts, academics, researchers or commentators specializing in Middle East affairs, conflict resolution, international relations or related fields, providing understanding and analysis of the conflict. If the actor is an ambassador/diplomat, include them as political representatives of the country concerned.

options.name: Media and journalists
options.description: The text cites information taken from other media (e.g. ""according to the New York Times...), to which no other spokesperson is assigned (it may be an investigative media outlet, information provided anonymously, etc.)

options.id: Očití svědci a civilisté z Izraele
options.name: Eye-witnesses and civilians from Israel
options.description: Israeli civilians affected by the conflict, providing testimony, a cemetery, a view of the events on the ground. Ordinary Israelis - survivors, relatives of the victims of 10/7, but also Israelis demonstrating against Netanyahu.

options.id: Očití svědci a civilisté z Palestiny
options.name: Eye-witnesses and civilians from Palestine
options.description: Palestinian civilians affected by the conflict, providing testimony, commentary, perspective on events on the ground - ordinary Palestinians
